availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane E. Miles Shean in Shelby County, Kentucky, on November 16, 1830. Father of Henry C. Shean, James R. Shean, and Alexander C. Shean. Farmer in Hardin County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Hardin County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 1, p. 290.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 1, p. 334B.
Eight Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 3, p. 42.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259285.
Federal Mortality Census Schedules, 1850-1880, and Related Indexes, 1850-1880, NARA RG, Microfilm Series T655, Hardin County, Kentucky, 1870, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
